snippet: The mayor of Castrillo Matajudíos, which translates roughly as Little Hill Fort of Jew Killers, is having a tough time persuading the village’s 56 registered inhabitants to support a new name.
abstract: Residents of Spain's Castrillo Matajudios, which translates roughly to Little Hill Fort of Jew Killers, are skeptical of Mayor Lorenzo Rodriguez's proposal to change village's name, which is a link to the persecution of Jews during the Spanish Inquisition; some accuse Rodriguez of self-promotion while others worry about possible archaeological digs to unearth Jewish ruins, and accompanying expense at time of deep cuts in state spending.
lead_paragraph: The mayor of Castrillo Matajudíos, which translates roughly as Little Hill Fort of Jew Killers, is having a tough time persuading the village’s 56 registered inhabitants to support a new name.

headline.main: A Hard Sell to Tame a Name in Spain
headline.print_headline: A Hard Sell to Tame a Name in Spain
